verses.kjv: And when the queen of Sheba heard of the fame of Solomon concerning the name of the LORD, she came to prove him with hard questions.
verses.ct: When the queen of Sheba heard about Solomon's reputation and his connection to the LORD, she traveled to test him with difficult questions.

verses.kjv: And she came to Jerusalem with a very great train, with camels that bare spices, and very much gold, and precious stones: and when she was come to Solomon, she communed with him of all that was in her heart.
verses.ct: She arrived in Jerusalem with an enormous entourage, along with camels carrying spices, a huge quantity of gold, and precious stones. When she met with Solomon, she discussed with him everything that was on her mind.

verses.kjv: And Solomon told her all her questions: there was not any thing hid from the king, which he told her not.
verses.ct: Solomon answered every one of her questions. Nothing was too complex for the king — he explained it all to her.

verses.kjv: And when the queen of Sheba had seen all Solomon’s wisdom, and the house that he had built,
verses.ct: When the queen of Sheba had observed all of Solomon's wisdom, the palace he had constructed,

verses.kjv: And the meat of his table, and the sitting of his servants, and the attendance of his ministers, and their apparel, and his cupbearers, and his ascent by which he went up unto the house of the LORD; there was no more spirit in her.
verses.ct: the food served at his table, the seating arrangement of his officials, the service of his attendants and their uniforms, his cupbearers, and the stairway he used to go up to the LORD's temple — she was completely overwhelmed.

verses.kjv: And she said to the king, It was a true report that I heard in mine own land of thy acts and of thy wisdom.
verses.ct: She told the king, "The report I heard back in my own country about your accomplishments and your wisdom was absolutely true."

verses.kjv: Howbeit I believed not the words, until I came, and mine eyes had seen it: and, behold, the half was not told me: thy wisdom and prosperity exceedeth the fame which I heard.
verses.ct: "But I didn't believe what people were saying until I came here and saw it with my own eyes. And honestly, I wasn't even told half of it! Your wisdom and wealth far surpass the reports I had heard."

verses.kjv: Happy are thy men, happy are these thy servants, which stand continually before thee, and that hear thy wisdom.
verses.ct: "How fortunate your people are! How fortunate these servants of yours are, who get to stand in your presence constantly and listen to your wisdom!"

verses.kjv: Blessed be the LORD thy God, which delighted in thee, to set thee on the throne of Israel: because the LORD loved Israel for ever, therefore made he thee king, to do judgment and justice.
verses.ct: "Praise the LORD your God, who was so pleased with you that he placed you on the throne of Israel. Because the LORD's love for Israel is eternal, he made you king to carry out justice and righteousness."

verses.kjv: And she gave the king an hundred and twenty talents of gold, and of spices very great store, and precious stones: there came no more such abundance of spices as these which the queen of Sheba gave to king Solomon.
verses.ct: Then she presented the king with 120 talents of gold, an enormous quantity of spices, and precious stones. Never again did such an abundance of spices arrive as what the queen of Sheba gave to King Solomon.

verses.kjv: And the navy also of Hiram, that brought gold from Ophir, brought in from Ophir great plenty of almug trees, and precious stones.
verses.ct: Hiram's fleet, which transported gold from Ophir, also brought back large shipments of almug wood and precious stones from Ophir.

verses.kjv: And the king made of the almug trees pillars for the house of the LORD, and for the king’s house, harps also and psalteries for singers: there came no such almug trees, nor were seen unto this day.
verses.ct: The king used the almug wood to make supports for the LORD's temple and for the royal palace, as well as harps and lyres for the musicians. Such a quantity of almug wood has never been imported or seen since that time.

verses.kjv: And king Solomon gave unto the queen of Sheba all her desire, whatsoever she asked, beside that which Solomon gave her of his royal bounty. So she turned and went to her own country, she and her servants.
verses.ct: King Solomon gave the queen of Sheba everything she wanted and asked for, in addition to what he gave her from his own royal generosity. Then she left and returned to her own country with her servants.

verses.kjv: Now the weight of gold that came to Solomon in one year was six hundred threescore and six talents of gold,
verses.ct: The total weight of gold that Solomon received in a single year was 666 talents of gold,

verses.kjv: Beside that he had of the merchantmen, and of the traffick of the spice merchants, and of all the kings of Arabia, and of the governors of the country.
verses.ct: not counting what came in from traders, the business of spice merchants, all the Arabian kings, and the regional governors.

verses.kjv: And king Solomon made two hundred targets of beaten gold: six hundred shekels of gold went to one target.
verses.ct: King Solomon made 200 large shields of hammered gold, with 600 shekels of gold going into each shield.

verses.kjv: And he made three hundred shields of beaten gold; three pound of gold went to one shield: and the king put them in the house of the forest of Lebanon.
verses.ct: He also made 300 smaller shields of hammered gold, with 3 pounds of gold in each one. The king placed them in the Palace of the Forest of Lebanon.

verses.kjv: Moreover the king made a great throne of ivory, and overlaid it with the best gold.
verses.ct: The king also constructed a magnificent throne made of ivory and covered it with the finest gold.

verses.kjv: The throne had six steps, and the top of the throne was round behind: and there were stays on either side on the place of the seat, and two lions stood beside the stays.
verses.ct: The throne had 6 steps, and the back of it was rounded at the top. There were armrests on both sides of the seat, with a lion standing next to each armrest.

verses.kjv: And twelve lions stood there on the one side and on the other upon the six steps: there was not the like made in any kingdom.
verses.ct: 12 lions stood on the 6 steps, one on each end of every step. Nothing like it had ever been made for any other kingdom.

verses.kjv: And all king Solomon’s drinking vessels were of gold, and all the vessels of the house of the forest of Lebanon were of pure gold; none were of silver: it was nothing accounted of in the days of Solomon.
verses.ct: All of King Solomon's drinking cups were gold, and every item in the Palace of the Forest of Lebanon was made of pure gold. Nothing was made of silver, because silver was considered worthless during Solomon's reign.

verses.kjv: For the king had at sea a navy of Tharshish with the navy of Hiram: once in three years came the navy of Tharshish, bringing gold, and silver, ivory, and apes, and peacocks.
verses.ct: The king had a fleet of trading ships at sea along with Hiram's fleet. Once every 3 years, the trading fleet would return carrying gold, silver, ivory, apes, and peacocks.

verses.kjv: So king Solomon exceeded all the kings of the earth for riches and for wisdom.
verses.ct: King Solomon surpassed every other king on earth in both wealth and wisdom.

verses.kjv: And all the earth sought to Solomon, to hear his wisdom, which God had put in his heart.
verses.ct: People from all over the world wanted an audience with Solomon to hear the wisdom that God had placed in his heart.

verses.kjv: And they brought every man his present, vessels of silver, and vessels of gold, and garments, and armour, and spices, horses, and mules, a rate year by year.
verses.ct: Each visitor brought gifts — articles of silver and gold, clothing, weapons, spices, horses, and mules — and this continued year after year.

verses.kjv: And Solomon gathered together chariots and horsemen: and he had a thousand and four hundred chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen, whom he bestowed in the cities for chariots, and with the king at Jerusalem.
verses.ct: Solomon also accumulated chariots and horsemen. He had 1,400 chariots and 12,000 horsemen, which he stationed in the chariot cities and with him in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And the king made silver to be in Jerusalem as stones, and cedars made he to be as the sycomore trees that are in the vale, for abundance.
verses.ct: The king made silver as common as rocks in Jerusalem, and cedar wood as plentiful as the sycamore trees in the lowlands.

verses.kjv: And Solomon had horses brought out of Egypt, and linen yarn: the king’s merchants received the linen yarn at a price.
verses.ct: Solomon's horses were imported from Egypt and from Kue. The king's merchants purchased them from Kue at the going price.

verses.kjv: And a chariot came up and went out of Egypt for six hundred shekels of silver, and an horse for an hundred and fifty: and so for all the kings of the Hittites, and for the kings of Syria, did they bring them out by their means.
verses.ct: A chariot imported from Egypt cost 600 shekels of silver, and a horse cost 150. They also exported them to all the Hittite kings and the Aramean kings through the same dealers.
